purpose: The code appears to be part of a malicious script that gathers system information including package names, public and private IP addresses, and file contents, then sends this data to a Discord webhook.
flows: package.json file contents -> callback -> Discord webhook
poc.txt file contents -> callback -> Discord webhook
system command outputs -> callback -> Discord webhook
IP address data -> callback -> Discord webhook
anomalies: Reading sensitive files like package.json and poc.txt
Sending system information to external service without user consent
analysis: The code reads system information including package name, public/private IP addresses, and file contents, then sends this data to a hardcoded Discord webhook. This is indicative of a malicious payload designed to exfiltrate information from compromised systems.
conclusion: This code represents a security risk as it exfiltrates system information to an external Discord webhook, potentially enabling unauthorized access and data theft.
